page.title: 17Torkington.
page.content: One part of the area is known as {Torkington. Torkington lodge}now houses the School Library Service but originally it was the home of the Lord of the Manor. The grounds are now a Public park with a variety of facilities including Tennis courts, Bowling greens,Football pitches and childrens swings and rounabouts.It is the site for a{Fair}and a travelling {Circus.}In the same area there is an {Over-60's Club}and a residential home for the elderly.Each resident has his own rooms and there is a matron present to help whenever necessary. These people are very interesting and welcome the chance to talk to anyone who visits them. Close by are a number of allotments, these are rented at a cost of 4p a square yard and people grow vegetables for themselves.
